thread.title: Any One With A Mobile Browser? (Want Help For My Site)

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I am creating a mobile search engine for cell phone users, right now I want to know if someone can access the mobile phone page on my website when you enter the main page with a mobile phone. I.E Iphone, Black Berry, etc.

When you enter the site using a Phone browser on the main page it should redirect you here:
mobile.bombinaid.com/

But go here first and if it doesn't redirect you to mobile.bombinaid. It isn't working then and I guest have too do some more research.

But any ways, just go too my website here and let me know if it works on the redirecting:
http://www.bombinaid.com

F.Y.I I am still working on the Settings and features of the Mobile Phone Website Viewer on there. So most of the links are aether not going to go anywhere or the web page is going to have a grammar error.

If someone can do this small task for me, that would be very useful for me and I would appreciate it, since I can't afford Web Service on my phone.

Thanks, Ajm113.

post.author: BNA!
post.body: Doesn't redirect -tried it with an iPhone.

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Interesting, must have gotten a tutorial that was dated before Iphone, can you give me a copy and paste between the quotes under the top right box where it says 'DEBUG' where it should show something like: Browser: "Browser Name/Version" on your Iphone?

http://www.bombinaid.com/?debug=on

I tested my site on using a Opera Browser Mini Online Simulator and it seems my site redirects it. So I know now its not the script itself that isn't working, its the list of mobile browsers that aren't listed.

Thanks BNA, I appreciate your help.

post.author: BNA!
post.body:
ajm113 wrote:
Interesting, must have gotten a tutorial that was dated before Iphone, can you give me a copy and paste between the quotes under the top right box where it says 'DEBUG' where it should show something like: Browser: "Browser Name/Version" on your Iphone?


Well, as you know the iPhone doesn't support copy and paste

So let me type it:

Browser:"Mozilla/5.0 (iPhone; U; CPU iPhone US 2_1 like Mac OX X; de-de) AppleWebKit/525.18.1(KHTML,like Gecko)Version/3.1.1 Mobile/5f136 Safari/525.20"

post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Really? Ha, the one other thing it can't do.

Awsome, thanks! Ok, now try it one more time with your Iphone with just bombinaid.com, at school right now. So I had to do a quick download, edit and upload.

post.author: ajm113
post.body: "Wicked sick", thanks again BNA, I appeciate your help!
